Arriving that night, we see that the pool is no longer open in the morning. If we had known that prior to booking we probably wouldn’t have stayed there because we were really looking forward to our morning swim.

I also think pet friendly hotels are great for all dog owners but, not if they have carpeting, I don’t think it’s appropriate flooring, it had a slight dog scent and my allergies acted up a little. I’m assuming that limits the clientel and will discourage non pet owners or whoever that isn’t bringing a pet along, to book there. I also like the fact the the bank is conveniently located right next to it. ・ This hotel is rather overpriced for a place with no fridge, no microwave, and no room safe for valuables. It would have been so nice to keep some cold beverages in my room and some snacks in the fridge. With that wonderful market there and so many good restaurants, I would also have been able to store leftovers in my room for later or the next day instead of having to waste so much food and spend so much on fresh meals everyday.

The pillows on the bed gave me a severe neck and shoulder pain which ruined my stay. They should be replaced with foam pillows or the hotel should at least be able to supply foam pillows for those who request them.

I also did not like the idea that they added a $300 deposit to my credit card at check in which took several weeks to drop off my card. Are they having that much of a problem with people stealing things or messing up the rooms?

I think it's high time the hotel along with the bank should urge the city of Montreal to do something about all the panhandling right outside the hotel. You can't step outside anytime day or night without street people jumping in your face for change.
I do not think I would stay there again unless there was no other option available.

・ DISGUSTING. WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED AT. This hotel states that it is a 4 star, in my opinion that is a lie. The room that I got was what i imagine a motel would be.Dirty, smelly, rude staff, photos do not match the actual hotel. The photos are from what i could tell that was the one renovated floors that the hotel has (which is classified as business) and apparently is an extra charge even though the photos for the regular double queen room has those photos. The original room I was given had live flies, cob webs, dust in the air, dust surrounding the vents etc, rotting doors, and holes in the walls . Checking in a 12 am I was extra upset. I lasted an hour in the room before i called and asked if there was another room... they then moved me to the business class room . Once i got that room, as soon as i walked into the room it was renovated BUT it was still smelly and dirty, there was a fruit pit on the floor as soon as i walked beside the bed. Called booking and basically the hotel lied to booking about what i had said and the stated that their hotel was only outdated (which was not even what i had complained about because i knew it was not going to be like the cosmo or wynn) and refused to do anything because they felt that that had upgraded me to a better floor even though that was the room that i had originally booked as per the photos for the specific booking. Either way even in the new room I slept ON TOP of the covers. Thank god booking did something on their end to make up for the unfortunate events. Overall not worth the money for the quality of hotel, stay anywhere else but here in Montreal.

・ Where do I begin. To start, when we arrived to the hotel after an 8 hour drive, we were told our reservation had been cancelled because of a 'faulty credit card'. We didn't receive any kind of contact from the hotel to inform us that this had been done. We were told that the only room they had was a 1 king bed. They expected the three of us to stay in one bed. In what world?

To make matters worse, the staff member who dealt with us was incredibly rude and disrespectful so much so that another staff member apologized to us when he witnessed the was the other man was speaking to us. After MUCH back and forth (at 5 a.m when we arrived, exhausted from our long drive), they finally told us they would put us in a room with a king bed and pull-out sofa for the night. When we got into our room and removed the cushions from the sofa we found a cheeto (not a joke) underneath. Needless to say we didn't feel comfortable sleeping in that pull-out bed and all of us ended up getting very little sleep in one bed together.

The management staff didn't seem too concerned with our negative experience. We received a negligible discount off our first night which does not come close to making up for what we went through. We won't be returning to this hotel and we definitely won't be recommending it to our family and friends. Not only was it overpriced for what you are getting (an outdated 3 star at most) but the staff don't bother to ensue you are satisfied with your stay.

The air exchange vent was absolutely filthy, (and we are supposed to breath in that air) the dresser was literally falling apart, the electrical sockets were so loose they couldn't be used, there was a big hole in the chair in the room, the tap was running and couldn't be turned off. There were 3 English Chanels on the tv out of the 12 total chanels that we had access to. The tv signal was dropping constantly. But, the worst part was the treatment of us by the female manager! She argued that we did get the requested bed types, she was clearly very unhappy and defensive when these issues were brought to her attention. Eventually, a miracle occurred and she was able to find a room fitting our original request on the 24th floor (whereas earlier she challenged us in our booking even though I had it on my phone and she said there were no such rooms available). We were moved to two rooms on a higher level and they were Much better.

Upon arrival, the parking attendant man was extremely rude when we couldn't fit our mini van in the tiny space he directed us into. We wished we could have left upon arrival but we booked rooms that were non-refundable.

Many people begging outside of hotel and you can actually watch the folks who are clearly 'on' something awful, as they pace and dance around and are present in the area. Only room available was near the elevators which we declined. We were waiting in the lounge for our room and a couple arrived and were given their room right away is it because we had booked through an agency? I guess we looked tired of waiting because the clerk called us over after another 10 minutes and said she was giving us an upgraded room so we could go to our room and rest it was around 15h00. We went to our room which was second down from the elevator so I did not sleep the whole night. Also the hairdryer in the bathroom was so filthy that I did not dare pick it up. I saw a cleaning lady on the floor and asked her for a rag and solution to clean the air dryer. She came right over and cleaned it herself. I apologized for disturbing her work that I only needed a rag but she insisted it was her job and was happy to do it. I thanked her for her expedient solution. That was a plus. In the bathroom the necessaries were there but there was no shower cap which was a lack. Also the bath tiles were a bit moldy, the sink was cracked. It was only for one night so I did not make a fuss. If that was an upgrade I hate to see what a normal room would be like. It had the same size beds has the room I had booked plus it was 2 doors down from the elevators which I would never have accepted if I had not been so tired of waiting for our room.
